abstractText: The Pacific lamprey (Entosphenus tridentatus) is in decline in the Columbia River Basin. Since 2000, adult Pacific Lamprey have been collected throughout the Columbia River basin to support various research, monitiong, and restoration efforts. These efforts includetranslocating adult lamprey to bypass difficult migration corridors as well as monitoring adult passage through tribuary and mainstem dams (e.g. radio and acoustic telemetry and PIT tagging). The purpose of this method is to indentify steps required to collect adult Pacific Lamprey to thesesupport research, monitiong, and restoration efforts.
title: Collection of adult Pacific Lamprey v1.0
